title: Verify acceptance criteria can be added as children

Cache curated frame phashes between pipeline stages to avoid redundant computation
description:
## Context
Currently, curated frame perceptual hashes (phashes) are computed twice during the pipeline: once in the CutVideoStage during boundary hardening (lines 209-211 in cut_video.py via BoundaryVerifier.compute_curated_hashes()) and again in the validation stage during final cleanliness verification. This redundant computation takes approximately 1 minute per pipeline run.

## Requirements
1. Cache the computed phashes in the artifact store after initial computation in CutVideoStage
2. Reuse cached phashes in validation stage instead of recomputing
3. Ensure cache is properly cleared when hits directory changes
4. Maintain backward compatibility with existing code paths
5. Add unit tests to verify caching behavior
6. Document the caching strategy in code comments

## Authority
This optimization is authorized under performance improvement guidelines. The boundary verification system is documented in cut_video.py lines 192-318 and BoundaryVerifier class in boundary/verifier.py lines 197-299.

## Implementation Context
- Current computation: BoundaryVerifier.compute_curated_hashes() in boundary/verifier.py (lines 250-299)
- Usage location 1: CutVideoStage.execute() in cut_video.py (line 209)
- Usage location 2: Validation framework in video_validator.py (needs investigation)
- Artifact store available via context.artifacts for inter-stage data passing

title: Implement phash caching in CutVideoStage after initial computation
description: Store computed phashes from BoundaryVerifier.compute_curated_hashes() in context.artifacts immediately after computation in CutVideoStage.execute() (line 209)

title: Update validation stage to retrieve and reuse cached phashes
description: Modify the validation framework in video_validator.py to check for cached phashes in context.artifacts before calling compute_curated_hashes()

title: Add cache invalidation logic when hits directory changes
description: Implement cache clearing mechanism to detect when hits directory has changed and invalidate cached phashes to ensure data consistency

title: Ensure backward compatibility with existing code paths
description: Verify that code paths without cached phashes continue to work correctly by gracefully falling back to compute_curated_hashes() if cache is unavailable

title: Add unit tests for phash caching behavior
description: Write tests to verify: phashes are correctly cached after initial computation, cached phashes are correctly retrieved in validation stage, cache invalidation works when hits directory changes

title: Document caching strategy in code comments
description: Add clear documentation in code comments explaining the phash caching strategy, how it works across pipeline stages, and when cache invalidation occurs
